title: 110_hr2317
content: The "Lobbying Transparency Act of 2007" requires registered lobbyists to submit quarterly reports on bundled contributions to specific recipients. The Lobbying Transparency Act of 2007 mandates registered lobbyists to submit quarterly reports on bundled contributions exceeding $5,000 to specific recipients. The Lobbying Transparency Act of 2007 requires registered lobbyists to report quarterly on bundled contributions over $5,000 to named recipients, excluding duplicate information already filed with the Senate and House of Representatives. Submission must be made within 25 days after the reporting period. The Lobbying Transparency Act of 2007 mandates registered lobbyists to disclose bundled contributions over $5,000 to named recipients. Lobbyists must send a statement to the recipient detailing the contributions and sources, allowing the recipient to challenge any information before submission. The definition of a registered lobbyist for disclosure purposes includes individuals required to register under specific sections. A registered lobbyist is considered to 'bundle' a contribution if they receive and forward it to the recipient, or if the contribution is credited to the recipient. The definition of a contribution in relation to registered lobbyists includes how it is credited or attributed to the recipient. Contributions are defined based on the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, with exceptions for amounts less than $200. Other terms such as candidate, political committee, and political party committee are also defined within the Act. The curr_chunk defines terms like 'covered recipient' and 'leadership PAC' in relation to Federal candidates and political committees. The effective date for the amendment is specified. The curr_chunk specifies the application of the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 to quarterly periods after the enactment of the Act. The Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 applies to quarterly periods after its enactment, passed by the House of Representatives on May 24, 2007.
